page.title: 13St.Donats Castle
page.content: St.Donats Castle is thought to date back to Norman times, but none of the present buildings has any Norman connection.The tiny church next to the castle contains some early Norman work, which might suggest there would also have been a castle here in Norman times.If this were so it would probably have been a wood and earthen motte and bailey affair. The stone castle was built by the Stradling family who probably came over with William the Conqueror.The earliest parts of the present castle were built at the end of the 13th. or the beginning of the 14th.century.The present castle is in the form of two concentric rings ,or curtain walks against which later buildings have been constructed.The Stradling family lived at the castle for 4 centuries.
